page.title: 09Community Life in Ridgehill
page.content: Although Ridgehill (Regil) is only a small village, its community life can be compared with that of a small town. Village life revolves around two groups - these are the Village Hall Committee who organise numerous social events in the new village hall, and the Conservative Association who organise outings and parties. The Crown Inn, to the north, is home to six local skittle teams. It is the local pub and also a small restaurant. In summer, there are occasional cricket games and village competitions (long time residents against newcomers). In winter, both young and old toboggan in nearby fields. There is quite a strong religious background in this farming area and there is a Sunday School. Recently a Drama Society has been formed. For its size, Regil is a very active village!
